Description: Body sherd of East Greek, possibly South Ionian, pottery cup, probably with everted rim; orientation uncertain; interior: glazed black (fired brownish-green to red); exterior: upper(?) wall black, edged above with red line; reserved below.
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer suggests that this sherd might belong to Type 9. Contrary to the typical Type 9 cups, this sherd has added red applied to its exterior surface. Furthermore, the fabric is not consistent with other South Ionian cups.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 714, no. 717)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 54, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.265) (Phase 3)
